headline.main: SUPPORT OF WAR URGED BY I.L.0.; Implementation of Atlantic Charter Asked as Ten-Day Conference Closes

lead_paragraph: The conference of the International Labor Organization ended its ten-day session at Columbia University yesterday after adopting resolutions calling for support of the democracies in the war, implementation of the Atlantic Charter proclaimed by President Roosevelt and Prime Minister Winston Churchill, facilitation of trade between the Americas, and wider participation of employers and workers in public agencies charged with the planning and application of public policies.
